about research projects modules archive

modules

an overview of my work with modules (github) under the uc berkeley division of data science and information.


2019

  • team lead


    fall

    unfortunately, due to understaffing, data engineers was put on hold :^( i'll be returning to the team lead position for this coming fall, as well as serving as tech support for modules.

  • data engineers lead


    spring

    i co-ran the first iteration of data engineers, a new initiative at the division to diversify the data sets used in technical courses to raise ethical questions or make them more inclusive and engaging.


    • 2018

  • team lead


    summer + fall

    i led two projects: ugba-96: data and decisions with conrad miller and er-131: data, environment, and society with duncan callaway. for ugba-96, i lead a team of three developers implementing autograders for six jupyter notebooks and for er-131, i worked with developers to create the homeworks and labs for this brand new course.

  • curriculum developer


    spring

    i made jupyter notebooks for legalst-190: data, prediction, and law. i developed notebooks that cover xml parsing and topic modelling.
